{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33531].
  {panel}

Hi Team,

When a user create a issue on JIRA using Crucible, this issue is liked to the user.
But if the user change this issue, like moving it to another project on JIRA, the link will not be changed on Crucible side.
It was going to be great if Jira could check if the issue on JIRA has reviews and ask to update it's links when moving between projects for example.

Thanks
fields.summary: Change links on JIRA and Crucible when moving a project.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33530].
  {panel}

Current:

UI in work log does not indicate that it has it's own comment stream. This results in users having to use the ALL tab in order to see work log comments inline with their normal comments. This shows significantly more information than the user is looking for.

Expected:

All comments and work log comments should be visible at once in the comment tab.

Requested improvement:

Add an option to show all comments inline. Not sure if this should be on a per user, per project, or per system level.
fields.summary: Add option to show work log comments inline with normal comments

fields.description:
_Steps to Reproduce_

* Create an issue {{TESTONE-1}} and include the comment "foo" inside the issue for the first comment:
!bug_1.JPG|thumbnail!

* Navigating to the *Advanced Search*, using the following parameter should not display the issue {{TESTONE-1}}:
{code}
comment !~ "foo"
{code}
!bug_2.JPG|thumbnail!

* However, navigating back to the issue page, try to add the second comment "bar" into the issue:
!bug_3.JPG|thumbnail!

* This issue is reproducible using the same parameter in the *Advanced Search* JQL whereby you can see that {{TESTONE-1}} is displayed, ignoring the original condition of the JQL:
!bug_4.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JQL parameter "!~" still not working properly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33522].
  {panel}

Sometimes a issue changes more than once per minute, e.q. in a meeting to get the issue 'ready'. If this is case, the reporter and watcher receives a email every time a change is entered in the issue. This is generating a lot of email.
(In our case the reporter is the customer and we don't want to get annoyed by the huge load of emails).

I would like to have the possibility (in a notification scheme) to delay the emails, so that multiple changes are combined in one email, rather than several smaller emails every change. Or the possibility to select to get only one email a day.

This improvement I would very much like to see in the next version.
fields.summary: Delayed sending of notifications emails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33521].
  {panel}

When JIRA is connected with Crowd and Crowd fails during the time that a user is using Confluence, the following stacktrace is displayed : 
{noformat}
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.CommunicationException
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdServiceImpl.convertOperationFailedException(CrowdServiceImpl.java:866)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdServiceImpl.authenticate(CrowdServiceImpl.java:79)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.DelegatingCrowdService.authenticate(DelegatingCrowdService.java:35)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.FilteredCrowdServiceImpl.authenticate(FilteredCrowdServiceImpl.java:51)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.login.LoginManagerImpl$InternalStaticDependencies.authenticate(LoginManagerImpl.java:415)
{noformat} 

Steps to reproduce :
* Integrate JIRA with Crowd
* Login to JIRA with a user from Crowd
* Shutdown Crowd 
* Try to perform some action on JIRA.

JIRA should catch the Crowd exception in a better way and communicate to the user that the Crowd server is no longer accessible.

h4.Diagnosis and Resolution
Please follow the diagnosis and resolution steps from the knowledge base article [JIRA drops LDAP configuration - java.naming.provider.url property does not contain a URL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+drops+LDAP+configuration+-+java.naming.provider.url+property+does+not+contain+a+URL].
fields.summary: JIRA should catch Crowd failures gracefully

fields.description:
{panel:title=Notes on the Fix Version/s|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#68cff2|bgColor=#E7F4FA}
This bug is fixed in:
* 7.10.1+ for 7.10.x
* 7.11.x and above
* 7.6.7+ for 7.6.x only

This means, 7.7.x, 7.8.x, and 7.9.x are all affected and there's no Fix Version in those minor releases. The reason why 7.6.x got a fix is because it's the [current Enterprise release|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/atlassian-enterprise-releases-948227420.html] (as of Sep 11, 2018).
{panel}

{panel:title=Description}
h4. Summary

User action failed when the URL has pipe "|" character and JIRA is running behind load balancer.
h4. Steps to reproduce
 # Setup JIRA behind load balancer
 # Perform action, such as transition issue (or user logout)

h4. Expected result

Issue gets transitioned successfully
h4. Actual Result

Transition fails with Communications Breakdown - The JIRA server could not be contacted" error dialog thrown in the UI
h4. Explanation

In Some JIRA URL, the pipe character is not accepted, which is as per stated in the following documentation:
 - [rfc2396.txt|http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2396.txt]

Quoting the paragraph which indicates that the pipe character is excluded:
{quote}2.4.3. Excluded US-ASCII Characters

Although they are disallowed within the URI syntax, we include here a
 description of those US-ASCII characters that have been excluded and
 the reasons for their exclusion.

The control characters in the US-ASCII coded character set are not
 used within a URI, both because they are non-printable and because
 they are likely to be misinterpreted by some control mechanisms.

control = <US-ASCII coded characters 00-1F and 7F hexadecimal>

The space character is excluded because significant spaces may
 disappear and insignificant spaces may be introduced when URI are
 transcribed or typeset or subjected to the treatment of word-
 processing programs. Whitespace is also used to delimit URI in many
 contexts.

space = <US-ASCII coded character 20 hexadecimal>

The angle-bracket "<" and ">" and double-quote (") characters are
 excluded because they are often used as the delimiters around URI in
 text documents and protocol fields. The character "#" is excluded
 because it is used to delimit a URI from a fragment identifier in URI
 references (Section 4). The percent character "%" is excluded because
 it is used for the encoding of escaped characters.

delims = "<" | ">" | "#" | "%" | <">

Other characters are excluded because gateways and other transport
 agents are known to sometimes modify such characters, or they are
 used as delimiters.

unwise =
{code:java}
"{" | "}" | "|" | "\" | "^" | "[" | "]" | "`"
{code}
Data corresponding to excluded characters must be escaped in order to
 be properly represented within a URI.
{quote}
Due to this, when our customer have JIRA running behind a load balancer that is RFC-2396 aware, some JIRA functionalities may not work. Some of the affected functions are:
 - User logout: [http://localhost:8082/jira1/logout?atl_token=B6U6-M2L6-IVGN-XXQU]|6f38bd4b12160e25f65580b3562a5c2ca3b96457|lin
 - Transitioning issue to a new status: [http://localhost:8082/jira1/secure/WorkflowUIDispatcher.jspa?id=10500&action=5&atl_token=B6U6-M2L6-IVGN-XXQU]|6f38bd4b12160e25f65580b3562a5c2ca3b96457|lin

In both of the above operations, the URL contains the pipe character, which means that the operation will break when we have JIRA running behind a load balancer.

Hence, it will be great if we can substitute the pipe character as needed so that JIRA will be compatible with RFC-2396

h4. Workaround

Replace the pipes with URL encoded character %07C
{panel}
fields.summary: RFC-2396: The pipe character "|" is not accepted

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33500].
  {panel}

As of now, the current filters that are available for the *Activity* option in the *Activity Stream Gadget* are:
# Attachment added
# Comment added
# Issue closed
# Issue created
# Issue edited
# Issue opened
# Issue progress started
# Issue progress stopped
# Issue reopened
# Issue resolved
# Issue transitioned

Is it possible to add finer filters to filter out separated activity like _customfield update_ or _add fix version_? This will allow users to filter out in more detail.
fields.summary: Additional filters for the Activity Stream Gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33477].
  {panel}

Using OnDemand JIRA 6.0.x (whatever the latest on-demand is)

If I go to:

Tools -> User Management
Then I find a user and click: Edit

I cannot add multiple email addresses. This edit profile dialog should allow administrators to associate multiple email addresses with a JIRA account.

Reasoning:
What would be the purpose of this?

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+Issues+and+Comments+from+Email

I have developers that have multiple email addresses for support reasons. If they try to raise an issue via email or add a comment to an issue via email and are signed into an email account not registered with JIRA - then JIRA doesn't know what to do with the email that it received (if you have create new users via email disabled - which we do). JIRA not knowing what to do with the unrecognizable email address is understandable. 

However we should be able to associate multiple email addresses with one JIRA user, so then JIRA will correctly be able to raise Issues or add comments to existing issues.

It is really irritating that JIRA does not support this. This means all developers need to inconveniently log out of their email and log into another email account OR mess with their email account settings and temporarily change their "sent from" setting to show the email address registered with JIRA. Sometimes switching "sent from" or email accounts means we can't do a simple cc / bcc: to our JIRA system as the email we need to send for support reasons needs to show up as sent from an email that is not registered with the JIRA user. So then it is a bunch more work to copy / paste stuff around and switch out the accounts to the correct email account registered with JIRA.

This is incredibly inconvenient and wastes a lot of time. Developers find this really annoying and say not so nice things. :-D
fields.summary: Allow multiple email addresses to be associated with one user
Issue detail view scrolls out of view on 11" MacBook Air
Custom Fields Are Only Viewable By Certain Users

fields.description:
This Bug is still in Standlaone ZIP of JIRA 6.0.2!

If install JIRA als Windows Service via service.bat, the Admin Gadged reports: 'mail.mime.decodeparameters' is not set to true

The origin of this is a bug in bin/service.bat line 165:
{code}"%EXECUTABLE%" //US//%SERVICE_NAME% ++JvmOptions "-Djava.awt.headless=true -Datlassian.standalone=JIRA -Dmail.mime.decodeparameters=true;-Dorg.apache.jasper.runtime.BodyContentImpl.LIMIT_BUFFER=true;-Djava.io.tmpdir=%CATALINA_BASE%\temp; ...{code}

As you see, between the first three JvmOptions there is no ";".
But this must be there. Because if not, these three Options wil be written on one line to the registry.
They are not working, cause every option must be on a new line.

So, before i can run "service.bat install", i always have to fix this line:
{code}"%EXECUTABLE%" //US//%SERVICE_NAME% ++JvmOptions "-Djava.awt.headless=true;-Datlassian.standalone=JIRA;-Dmail.mime.decodeparameters=true;-Dorg.apache.jasper.runtime.BodyContentImpl.LIMIT_BUFFER=true;-Djava.io.tmpdir=%CATALINA_BASE%\temp; ...{code}

Can you please fix this in the next Standalone ZIP file?
thx!
fields.summary: "'mail.mime.decodeparameters' is not set to true" when using service.bat

fields.description:
h5. Steps to Reproduce:

# Startup a JIRA version 5.0 or later.
# Go to General Configuration and switch on External User Management
# Go to the User Browser, you'll be able to create or edit users
# Go to the Group Browser, you'll be able to create or edit groups

h5. Expected Results:

After External User Management is switch on, user or groups should not be possible to create or edit in the User or Group browser.

External User Management option description quote:

{quote}
When turned ON, you will no longer be able to create, edit or delete users/groups from within JIRA (or via email or import); but you can still assign users/groups to project roles, and create/edit/delete user properties. Additionally, JIRA will not display options for users to change their password, or edit their profile.
Generally you would only turn this ON if you are managing all your users from outside JIRA (e.g. using Crowd, Microsoft Active Directory or another LDAP directory).
{quote}

h5. Actual Results:
* Admin still able to create or edit users or groups under the User or Group browser.
fields.summary: JIRA able to create or edit user/groups when external user management is on.

fields.description:
When using a non-default column layout in Internet Explorer 9, a row is sometimes displayed with its text shifted over by a column - e.g. the Type field will contain the expected symbol, but the Key field will be empty and each column will contain the previous column's text (e.g. the Summary text will be displayed in the Assignee column).

The issue gets triggered fairly regularly by clicking on different column headers to select which to sort by.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33461].
  {panel}

If you click on any filter right now, the URL will include the first issue from the result set in it. If you send this to another user, since the first issue is in the URL it will be included. Even if the issue no longer falls within the filter, it will perpetually show the "extra" issue in the detail pane. See screenshot for details.

Workaround:

1. Switch to list view. Resulting link will be like: https://jira.atlassian.com/issues/?filter=12345
2. Right click on the filter link and use that. The format will be something like: https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?mode=hide&requestId=12345
fields.summary: Improve ability to link to filter results in detail view in issue navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33458].
  {panel}

We have dozens of projects in Jira and are creating more over time.  We would prefer a project key length greater than 10 characters because we will shortly run into uniqueness problems with how we like to name and key our projects. 

A length of 16 would serve us much better - 10 is too restrictive in our view.

The convention we use for project keys is:
[product abbreviation]_[release]

Examples:
PROD1_1311
PROD1_1312
PROD2_1401
PROD2_1405

Concerns we have are the following:
a) we have many product lines and we prefer the Jira project key be descriptive and recognizable 
b) we sometimes have long release labels
c) we would prefer that dots(.) be allowed to better match our releases
d) we currently use [A-Za-z0-9_\.]+ for our custom project key pattern (regex)
e) we like to keep current with Jira, but moving from 5.x to 6.x is currently a concern because of Project Keys.
fields.summary: Jira Project Key length and values

This is reported from https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/178835/atlas-run-in-tutorial-jira-simple-csv-importer-does-not-work

fields.description:
_Steps to Replicate_

# Create a multi-select custom field but *not assigned* to any screens:
!custom_1.JPG|thumbnail!
# The options that are available for the custom fields are as follows (1 until 5). No default values are set: 
!custom_2.JPG|thumbnail!
# Navigate to the *Field Configuration* and make it {color:red}Required{color}:
!custom_3.JPG|thumbnail!
# When you are creating a new issue, the following error will be displayed even though the custom field is not associated to the screen:
!custom_4.JPG|thumbnail!

(i) But, *this behaviour is not consistent in JIRA*. In other Workflow Transition, the issue can be transit even if the field is not associated to the screen. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a new custom field
# Map it to the Create Issue screen
# Create a new issue, leave the custom field blank
# Make the custom field as Required in the field configurations
# Re-Index JIRA to make sure the new configuration does take effect on the issue
# Try to resolve the issue, note that the field do not appear in the Resolve Issue screen, and that the issue can be resolved successfully without specifying the custom field value
(!) we also observe that the custom field will be required in the Resolve Issue transition if we map it to the Resolve Issue screen.
fields.summary: Custom Field is Required even though it is not assigned to any Screens

  {panel}

Activities on issues display "Updated 1 hour ago" instead of the actual time stamp. I've searched through the support documentation for 6.0.1 and earlier versions, and have been unable to find instructions for Administrators to change the configuration to always display the actual time/date of activity.

Please advise.
h5. Workaround:
 * Modify the jira-config.properties file and add this line:
{code:java}
jira.lf.date.relativize = false


{code}

 * This will not affect all areas of JIRA, such as the Activity Stream

*Note:* 
 # The {{jira-config.properties}} file is not created by default. If the file is not already created, you need to do so. For more details please refer to our [Advanced JIRA Configuration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+JIRA+Configuration] page
 #  Modifications in the  {{jira-config.properties}} file is not supported in Cloud.
fields.summary: Make View change timestamp configurable (use time instead of "1 hour ago")

fields.description:
The command "atlas-run-standalone.bat --product jira" worked fine in the Plugin SDK 4.2.0.
In 4.2.1 this does not work anymore but maven complains that it cannot parse --product.
In 4.2.0 the commandline parameter was translated (like others similarly) to "-Dproduct=jira".
In 4.2.1 this translation was removed, but the help and tutorials still refer to the --product syntax.
So either the batch file (and others?) should be changed back, or the documentation needs to be updated in that file and on the website in tutorials like https://developer.atlassian.com/display/DOCS/Explore+the+Installed+SDK+and+the+atlas+Commands
fields.summary: atlas-run-standalone.bat is "broken" in Plugin SDK 4.2.1

fields.description:
I tried to follow the tutorial to create a JIRA plugin, but it doesn't work for me at all.
I stated my problem here: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/174059/problems-in-plugin-tutorial but unfortunately Sultan was not too helpful and doesn't respond anymore since two weeks.
So I started to investigate a bit further what happens here since I'm back from vacation now and found a problem that is easily fixable in the plugin SDK, so I'm reporting it here.
The problem is the following:

* The Tutorial {{pom.xml}} depends on {{jira-testkit-client}}
* {{jira-testkit-client}} depends on {{jersey-apache-client}}
* {{jersey-apache-client}} has {{jersey-contribs}} as parent pom
* {{jersey-contribs}} has {{jersey-project}} as parent pom
* {{jersey-project}} defines a repository {{glassfish-repository}} with URL {{http://maven.glassfish.org/content/groups/glassfish}}
* This URL is not valid anymore and redirects to a {{https://maven.glassfish.org/content/groups/glassfish}} instead with an HTTP 303 redirect.
* Unfortunately Maven does not follow such a redirect but takes the returned content as .pom file and also as the content for the checksum files.
* Then {{jvnet-parent}}, which is the parent of {{jersey-project}} is tried to be resolved via that glassfish repository as it is not found in other earlier repositories
* Then the checksum validation of course fails because the pom and checksum files contain the 303 HTML page and the build fails
* Additionally, {{https://maven.glassfish.org/content/groups/glassfish}} presents a certificate that is not valid vor {{maven.glassfish.org}}, but for {{maven.java.net}} which actually is the same as {{maven.glassfish.org}} which Maven also cannot handle.

So to fix this error, I had to correct this repository URL by adding

{code:xml}
<mirror>
    <id>glassfish-repository</id>
    <mirrorOf>glassfish-repository</mirrorOf>
    <name>Repository for Glassfish</name>
    <url>https://maven.java.net/content/groups/glassfish/</url>
</mirror>
{code}

to {{...\atlassian-plugin-sdk\apache-maven\conf\settings.xml}} and deleting the files with the wrong content from {{~\.m2\repository\net\java\jvnet-parent}}.

After this, the atlas-run.bat command came some steps further (while not bringing up JIRA with the plugin, but I'll open another answer for this)

So to fix this issue, I'd like to ask to add the mirror definition to the settings.xml file of the SDK.

fields.description:
When we upload a transparent PNG into a JIRA ticket, JIRA will make the background white.

When we download the attachment, it is not the same as the original, it is no longer transparent - it has a white background.

This prevents us from using JIRA to transfer art assets between teams.

Repro steps:
1) create ticket
2) upload transparent PNG
3) download PNG - it is no longer transparent.

Transparent image attached to this ticket. When you preview the image, the background is white. However, once you download it, you will see it actually has a gray background.
fields.summary: Uploaded transparent PNGs get distorted

In the Edit notification page:

https://hostedpa.atlassian.net/secure/admin/EditNotifications!default.jspa?lin&schemeId=10000

Since these two things are actually connected but one (notifications) is under Issues and one (events) is under System - that link would be very helpful to immediately see the connection.

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33425].
  {panel}

Most Java development tools (like Eclipse or IntelliJ IDEA) are able to download source code when needed, for debugging or developing.

Still, because Atlassian limits the access to the Jira source code, the automatic source code download fails, requiring people to login to Atlassian download source and  manually configure the links to the source code in your IDE. 

This makes the development process harder while it does not add any benefits to Atlassian. 

If someone really wants to get Jira without paying, they will always find ways to get the source code. The current limitation is just hurting normal customers.
fields.summary: Jira source code should be downloadable via standard ways (maven) - not limited

It's not clear what the User Property option is in JIRA.  We can add a key and value to a user, but what does this do?

The documentation doesn't really clarify what this feature is:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Users#ManagingUsers-Addingapropertytoauser

Can we get some explanation on this?
fields.summary: Clarify User Property Documentation

fields.description:
h5. Regression of JRA-18819

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Create new Project and Issues and assign the issues to yourself;
# Modify the *Field Configuration* being used by the issues and [hide the *Resolution* field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Specifying+Field+Behaviour#SpecifyingFieldBehaviour-Hidingorshowingafield];
# View the *Assigned to Me* gadget.

h3. Expected Behavior:
JIRA would continue showing the issues that were assigned to the user.

h3. Actual Behavior:
JIRA does not display any issues that use a *Field Configuration* where the  *Resolution* field is hidden.

h3. Workaround:
Either make the *Resolution* field visible again in the *Field Configuration* used by those issues, or replace the *Assigned to Me* gadget with a *Filter Results* gadget using a custom filter.
fields.summary: Assigned to Me gadget only returns issues that have the Resolution in the Field Configuration - Regression

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33406].
  {panel}

Currently the "Supported Platofrms" documentation for JIRA 4.4 states for Postgres database : 
 bq. PostgreSQL 8.2 and later with PostgreSQL Driver 8.4.x.
This is not correct as we clearly do not support Postgres 9 with JIRA 4.4. Please change this section to  : 
bq. PostgreSQL 8.2, 8.3, 8.4 with PostgreSQL Driver 8.4.x
fields.summary: Change the database section for "Supported Platforms" page on JIRA 4.4 documentation

fields.description:
If I click on a issue link from anywhere in JIRA or paste an issue link into the address bar the issue is not displayed instead it is redirected to the search page.

Example if I paste https://mobile.intranet/jira/browse/MDO-212 IE gets redirected to an URL of https://mobile.intranet/jira/i#browse/MDO-212?issueKey=MDO-212&serverRenderedViewIssue=true this happens on all issue links.

We are going to have to revert our install back to JIRA 5 as we have 400 users with a high percentage using IE9.
fields.summary: Issue links do not open in Internet Explorer 8 or 9 with Chrome Frame installed

Hi,

I've created a Chrome extension for that, but it would be better if it were a default feature of JIRA so I wouldn't have to tweak all of Atlassian's JIRA instances.

Basically, from the fixVersion, it would be nice to reach the Manage Versions, because when you're about to enter the version you've just released, you're always missing the right version. See attached screenshot, a few people already told me they thought it was a default feature of JIRA ;)

Cheers,
Adrien
fields.summary: Reach Manage Versions from the Issue view
